title: 109_hr3558
content: The Act may be cited as the "Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe Equitable Compensation Amendments Act of 2005". Congress finds that the Oahe Dam and Reservoir Project, a major component of the Pick-Sloan Missouri River Basin program, flooded the Cheyenne River Sioux Reservation, causing significant economic and cultural damage to the tribe. Compensation has been provided to affected Indian tribes, including the Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe. The Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe Equitable Compensation Act (Public Law 106-511; 114 Stat. 2365) created the Cheyenne River Sioux Tribal Recovery Trust Fund to compensate members who lost land due to the Oahe Dam and Reservoir Project. This Act aims to provide compensation and capitalize the Trust Fund. The Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe Equitable Compensation Act (Public Law 106-511; 114 Stat. 2365) established the Cheyenne River Sioux Tribal Recovery Trust Fund to compensate members for land lost to the Oahe Dam and Reservoir Project. The Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe Equitable Compensation Act (Public Law 106-511; 114 Stat. 2365) is amended to ensure fair compensation for the Tribe and member landowners for land acquired under the Oahe Dam and Reservation project. Definitions in the Act are also revised for clarity. The Equitable Compensation Act (Public Law 106-511; 114 Stat. 2365) is amended to define terms like "member landowner" and "power program" related to the Cheyenne River Sioux Reservation. Additionally, the Cheyenne River Sioux Tribal Recovery Trust Fund section is revised for funding. The Cheyenne River Sioux Tribal Recovery Trust Fund under the Equitable Compensation Act is amended to require the Secretary of the Treasury to deposit 25 percent of the power program funds into the Fund annually. This amount includes a base sum of $290,722,958 plus accrued interest. The Cheyenne River Sioux Tribal Recovery Trust Fund is amended to require the Secretary of the Treasury to deposit 25 percent of power program funds annually. This includes a base sum of $290,722,958 plus accrued interest calculated using the Lehman Government Bond Index. The Cheyenne River Sioux Tribal Recovery Trust Fund is amended to require the Secretary of the Treasury to deposit 25 percent of power program funds annually. This includes a base sum of $290,722,958 plus accrued interest calculated using the Lehman Government Bond Index. Beginning on October 1, 2005, additional compensation may be provided to member landowners for land acquisition in the Oahe Dam and Reservoir Project. The Secretary of the Interior must provide requested records to assist the Tribe in processing claims of heirs of member landowners within 60 days. The Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe Equitable Compensation Act is amended to include member landowners in eligibility for certain programs and services.
